intro: Ageratina eleazarii, commonly known as the eleazar's ageratum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with hairy stems and serrated leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom during the rainy season. Ageratina eleazarii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along riverbanks.
